meanings.sent1: The enemy reinvaded our territory last night.
meanings.sent2: The ants reinvaded the kitchen after we cleaned it.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels reinvaded the bird feeder, determined to get more seeds.
meanings.sent4: Memories of the past reinvaded her mind like an unstoppable army.
meanings.sent5: The weeds reinvaded the garden, spreading quickly and taking over.

meanings.sent1: The burglars reinvaded the house through the back door.
meanings.sent2: The floodwaters reinvaded the town after the dam broke.
meanings.sent3: The kids reinvaded the playground, eager to play tag again.
meanings.sent4: The storm reinvaded the peaceful town, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The virus reinvaded the community, causing concern among the residents.
